alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:12AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sequatchie, southwestern Bledsoe, northeastern Marion and north central Hamilton Counties through 600 AM EDT/500 AM CDT/... At 512 AM EDT/412 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whitwell, or 8 miles southwest of Dunlap, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dunlap, Soddy-Daisy, Whitwell, Fairmount, Powells Crossroads, Cartwright, Flat Top Mountain, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Griffith Creek and Chimneys State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
